doc.field: Regional Parcel Dataset - Year-End 2008, Seven County Twin Cities Metropolitan Area
Regional Parcel Dataset - Year-End 2008, Seven County Twin Cities Metropolitan Area
The Metropolitan Council and the Counties of Anoka, Carver, Dakota, Hennepin, Ramsey, Scott and Washington
The Metropolitan Council and the Counties of Anoka, Carver, Dakota, Hennepin, Ramsey, Scott and Washington
Counties of Anoka, Carver, Dakota, Hennepin, Ramsey, Scott and Washington
Counties of Anoka, Carver, Dakota, Hennepin, Ramsey, Scott and Washington

This dataset is a compilation of tax parcel polygon and point layers from the seven Twin Cities, Minnesota metropolitan area counties of Anoka, Carver, Dakota, Hennepin, Ramsey, Scott and Washington. The seven counties were assembled into a common coordinate system. No attempt has been made to edgematch or rubbersheet between counties. A standard set of attribute fields is included for each county. (See section 5 of the metadata). The attributes are the same for the polygon and points layers. Not all attributes are populated for all counties.
The polygon layer contains one record for each real estate/tax parcel polygon within each county's parcel dataset. Some counties will polygons for each individual condominium, and others do not. (See Completeness in Section 2 of the metadata for more information.) The points layer includes the same attribute fields as the polygon dataset. The points are intended to provide information in situations where multiple tax parcels are represented by a single polygon. The primary example of this is the condominium. Condominiums, by definition, are legally owned as individual, taxed real estate units. Records for condominiums may not show up in the polygon dataset. The points for the point dataset often will be randomly placed or stacked within the parcel polygon with which they are associated.
The polygon layer is broken into individual county shape files. The points layer is one file for the entire metro area.
In many places a one-to-one relationship does not exist between these parcel polygons or points and the actual buildings or occupancy units that lie within them. There may be many buildings on one parcel and there may be many occupancy units (e.g. apartments, stores or offices) within each building. Additionally, no information exists within this dataset about residents of parcels. Parcel owner and taxpayer information exists for many, but not all counties.
Polygon and point counts for each county are as follows (based on the October 2008 dataset unless otherwise noted):
polygons points Anoka 129139 129138 Carver 38134 38133 Dakota 135925 150294 Hennepin 422976 446623 Ramsey 149169 168233 Scott 55191 55191 Washington 98915 103915
This is a MetroGIS Regionally Endorsed dataset. (See http://www.metrogis.org/data/about/index.shtml#whatis for more information.)
Each of the seven Metro Area counties has entered into a multiparty agreement with the Metropolitan Council to assemble and distribute the parcel data for each county as a regional (seven county) parcel dataset.
Additional information may be available in the individual metadata for each county at the links listed below. Also, any questions or comments about suspected errors or omissions in this dataset can be addressed to the contact person listed in the individual county metadata.
Anoka = http://www.datafinder.org/metadata/anok_parcels.htm
Carver = http://www.datafinder.org/metadata/carv_parcels.htm
Dakota = http://www.datafinder.org/metadata/dako_parcels.htm
Hennepin = http://www.datafinder.org/metadata/henn_parcels.htm
Ramsey = http://www.datafinder.org/metadata/rams_parcelregions.htm
Scott = http://www.datafinder.org/metadata/scot_parcels.htm
Washington = http://www.co.washington.mn.us/info_for_residents/survey_and_land_management_division/survey_unit/metadata_for_parcel_data/

(See Completeness in Section 2 of the metadata for more information.) The points layer includes the same attribute fields as the polygon dataset. The points are intended to provide information in situations where multiple tax parcels are represented by a single polygon. The primary example of this is the condominium. Condominiums, by definition, are legally owned as individual, taxed real estate units. Records for condominiums may not show up in the polygon dataset. The points for the point dataset often will be randomly placed or stacked within the parcel polygon with which they are associated.
The polygon layer is broken into individual county shape files. The points layer is one file for the entire metro area.
In many places a one-to-one relationship does not exist between these parcel polygons or points and the actual buildings or occupancy units that lie within them. There may be many buildings on one parcel and there may be many occupancy units (e.g. apartments, stores or offices) within each building. Additionally, no information exists within this dataset about residents of parcels. Parcel owner and taxpayer information exists for many, but not all counties.
Polygon and point counts for each county are as follows (based on the October 2008 dataset unless otherwise noted):
polygons points Anoka 129139 129138 Carver 38134 38133 Dakota 135925 150294 Hennepin 422976 446623 Ramsey 149169 168233 Scott 55191 55191 Washington 98915 103915
This is a MetroGIS Regionally Endorsed dataset. (See http://www.metrogis.org/data/about/index.shtml#whatis for more information.)

Anoka = http://www.datafinder.org/metadata/anok_parcels.htm
Carver = http://www.datafinder.org/metadata/carv_parcels.htm
Dakota = http://www.datafinder.org/metadata/dako_parcels.htm

This includes the counties of Anoka, Carver, Dakota, Hennepin, Ramsey, Scott and Washington in Minnesota.</supplinf></descript><timeperd><timeinfo><sngdate><caldate>20090101</caldate></sngdate></timeinfo><current>This dataset reflects the status of each county's parcel polygon and attribute database as of the following dates:
Anoka = 12/30/2008 for polygons and 12/16/2008 for attributes Carver = 01/26/2009 for polygons and 01/26/2009 for attributes Dakota = 01/22/2009 for polygons and 01/22/2009 for attributes Hennepin = 01/01/2009 for polygons and 01/01/2009 for attributes Ramsey = 01/05/2009 for polygons, attribute dates vary Scott = 01/17/2009 for polygons and 01/17/2009 for attributes Washington = 11/30/2008 for polygons and 11/30/2008 for attributes</current></timeperd><status><progress>Complete</progress><update>Quarterly</update></status><spdom><bounding><westbc>-94.012</westbc><eastbc>-92.732</eastbc><northbc>45.415</northbc><southbc>44.471</southbc></bounding></spdom><keywords><theme><themekt>None</themekt><themekey>parcels, regional parcel data, cadastre, land ownership</themekey></theme><place><placekey>Twin Cities, Anoka County, Carver County, Dakota County, Hennepin County, Ramsey County, Scott County, Washington County</placekey></place></keywords><accconst>None</accconst><useconst>None</useconst><browse><browsen>http://www.datafinder.org/metadata/bg/metrogis_regional_parcels.jpg</browsen><browsed>Sample map showing the MetroGIS Regional Parcel Data.</browsed></browse><native>See metadata for individual counties.</native><crossref><citeinfo><title>Various parcel datasets available at the MetroGIS DataFinder website at http://www.datafinder.org/catalog/index.asp#LandOwnership</title></citeinfo></crossref><ptcontac><cntinfo><cntperp><cntorg>MetroGIS</cntorg></cntperp><cntaddr><addrtype> mailing and physical address </addrtype></cntaddr><cntemail>metrogis-contacts@metc.state.mn.us</cntemail></cntinfo></ptcontac></idinfo><dataqual><attracc><attraccr>A standard set of attribute fields is included for each county. However, not all attributes are available for all counties. No attempt has been made by MetroGIS to assess the accuracy of the attribute data.
Any questions or comments about suspected errors or omissions in this dataset can be addressed to the contact person listed in the individual county metadata. Links to that metadata can be found in the Horizontal Positional Accuracy element below.</attraccr></attracc><logic>No attempt was made to edgematch or rubbersheet the seven counties, thus overlaps and gaps will exist between counties. Not all tax parcels are represented by a unique polygon. For example, a county might have one polygon representing a condominium complex. Some counties have provided an additional parcel points shape file that will include points to represent such tax parcels (e.g. a point for each individual condominium).</logic><complete>For parcel attributes, see Section 5 of this metadata. For parcel geography, see metadata for individual counties.
Any questions or comments about suspected errors or omissions in this dataset can be addressed to the contact person listed in the individual county metadata. Links to that metadata can be found in the Horizontal Positional Accuracy element below.
Inclusion of Condominiums in Polygon Dataset: Some counties include condominium information within their polygon dataset and others do not. Some information on this topic is shown below. Contact each county for further information.
Anoka: Individual condominiums are included within the polygon dataset by subdividing the larger, common area parcel polygon of the condos into smaller polygons. These smaller polygons do not represent the actual geography of the condominiums, but do lie within the larger condo parcel.
Carver and Scott Individual condominiums are included within the polygon dataset using stacked polygons with the same geography for each condominium tax parcel.
Dakota, Hennepin, Ramsey and Washington One polygon is included in the polygon dataset for the geography of the larger common area of a condominium building or complex. Individual condominium units are only represented in the points dataset.
Note: For Carver County, where a point represents a tax parcel that has multiple, noncontiguous polygons, a single point will be placed within one of the polygons.</complete><posacc><horizpa><horizpar>See the Data Quality section of the metadata for individual counties at the following links:
Anoka = http://www.datafinder.org/metadata/anok_parcels.htm#dataqual
Carver = http://www.datafinder.org/metadata/carv_parcels.htm#dataqual
Dakota = http://www.datafinder.org/metadata/dako_parcels.htm#dataqual
Hennepin = http://www.datafinder.org/metadata/henn_parcels.htm#dataqual
Ramsey = http://www.datafinder.org/metadata/rams_parcel_regions.htm#dataqual
Scott = http://www.datafinder.org/metadata/scot_parcels.htm#dataqual
Washington = http://www.datafinder.org/metadata/wash_parcels.htm#dataqual</horizpar></horizpa></posacc><lineage><srcinfo><srcscale /></srcinfo><procstep><procdesc>Each county provided parcel polygons and points with attributes in shape file format with UTM coordinates, to the Metropolitan Council. The Metropolitan Council checked each shape file to insure it had the specified field names, types, lengths and order.
No attempt was made to edgematch or rubber sheet the parcel geography between counties.</procdesc></procstep></lineage></dataqual><spdoinfo><indspref>None</indspref><direct>Vector</direct><mgmg3obj>polygon shapes</mgmg3obj><mgmg3til>Polygons: One shape file for each of the seven counties. Points: One shape file for entire region.</mgmg3til></spdoinfo><eainfo><overview><eaover>A standard set of attribute fields is included for each county. The attributes are identical for the point and polygon datasets. Not all attributes fields are populated by each county.
A list of the attribute names is shown below. Detailed information about the attributes can be found at: http://www.datafinder.org/metadata/MetroGIS_Regional_Parcels_Attributes_2008.pdf

Preserve Enrolled date 8 AGPRE_EXPD Ag. Preserve Expiration date 8 PARC_CODE Parcel Polygon to Parcel Point numeric 2 and PIN Relationship Code</eaover><eadetcit>A detailed description of the attributes available in this dataset can be found at http://www.datafinder.org/metadata/MetroGIS_Regional_Parcels_Attributes_2008.pdf</eadetcit></overview></eainfo><distinfo><resdesc>MetroGIS Regional Parcels 2008</resdesc><distliab>NOTICE: The Geographic Information System (GIS) Data to which this notice is attached are made available pursuant to the Minnesota Government Data Practices Act (Minnesota Statutes Chapter 13).
